results.title: Divided trail: a Native American odyssey
results.brief_description: Uses archival footage and stills to document the beginnings of the American Indian protest movement in Chicago during the 1970s. Three leaders of the movement recount the events which motivated them to bring public attention to the plight of the American Indian, who has left the reservation with promises of employment and a better life only to find unemployment, slums and alcoholism.

results.title: Dites-Lui Que Je L'aime = Tell Her that I'm in Love
results.creator_credit: Claude Miller, Hubert Niogret and Maurice Bernart
results.brief_description:
David is an accountant. He leaves town every Friday, pretending he is going to take care of his parents at their old people’s home. But actually his parents are dead, and he spends the week-ends converting a chalet. He intends to live there with Lise, a woman he knows and loves since childhood. But Lise is married to another and has a baby. David’s mad love does not see those facts as an obstacle…

Credits: Producers, Maurice Bernart, Hubert Niogret ; director, Claude Miller ; writers, Claude Miller, Luc Beraud ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Alain Jomy ; art director, Hilton McConnico.
Cast: Christian Clavier, Jacques Denis, Gerard Depardieu, Dominique Laffin, Miou-Miou, Claude Pieplu, Josiane Balasko.

results.title: Distant islands
results.creator_credit: Bettina Maylone, Jack Long and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: As in her previous film, the award-winning The Hometown, the filmmaker has used applique and embroidered tapestries to animate a story from her childhood. Distant Islands recalls a young girl’s happy summers spent sailing with her family off the coast of British Columbia. Each tapestry, meticulously stitched by hand with brightly colored yarns, evokes a memory of leisurely days at sea, drifting among the islands.

results.title: Distinguished guests
results.creator_credit: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Christopher (Colin Friels) is sure he really likes psychology - but not the way it is taught at his university. Professor Wiseman, his tutor, is a disciple of the eminent European pyschologist, Professor Eisenbach - a cold rational behaviourist whose books are always cited as authorities. As a joke, Christopher and his girlfriend decide that he will impersonate Eisenbach and teach Professor Wiseman a lesson. Co-written by PJ Hogan (Muriel’s Wedding). Also features Tracy Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS

results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description:
Morris loves Jack - or does he?
Jack is a young, dedicated policewoman who lives with Morris, a charming but lazy layabout. But he has become a habit she can’t break and so she puts up with the frustrations and disappointments of living with him - until one night the police are called to a noisy party…Cast includes Kris McQuade, John Hargreaves, Bill Hunter and David Boyd.

results.title: Perception structure or flow (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bob Nichol and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Seeing is believing, and believing is seeing, says this film, in an engaging, involving exanimation of what perception is - what causes one person to see things one way, another person in a totally different way. A film to stimulate discussion, especially in the classroom at senior levels.

results.title: Pepper's ghost effect, triangles, cyan and red
results.credit_line:
Taree Mackenzie, Australia

Acrylic, MDF, reflective tint, LEDs, mirror ball motor, paint, wood and vinyl

Exhibition iteration

ACMI Collection
results.material_description: mixed media. acrylic, MDF, reflective tint, LEDs, mirror ball motor, paint, wood and vinyl
results.brief_description: Taree Mackenzie’s Pepper’s ghost, triangles, cyan and red gives new life to the Victorian-era invention made popular by John Henry Pepper. Pepper’s ghost was an early special effect that projected ghosts onto theatre stages through light and reflection.

constellations_primary.name: Colour and illusion
constellations_primary.description: Exploring the science of colour, light, reflection and movement.

results.title_for_label: Pepper’s ghost effect, triangles, cyan and red
results.description:
Pepper’s ghost effect, triangles, cyan and red gives new life to the Victorian-era invention made popular by John Henry Pepper. Pepper’s ghost was an early special effect that projected ghosts onto theatre stages through light and reflection.

“Pepper’s ghost has typically been used in theatre, film and amusement park rides. This simple effect uses an angled pane of glass to create the illusion of a ghost-like image within another scene, exploiting the optical properties of glass as both a reflector and transmitter of light.

In my work I wanted to replicate this effect using simple abstract forms and flat fields of colour to draw attention to this merging of the two light images, while also laying bare the apparatus used to create the illusion.” – Taree Mackenzie
description_for_label:
Pepper’s ghost effect, triangles, cyan and red gives new life to the Victorian-era invention made popular by John Henry Pepper. Pepper’s ghost was an early special effect that projected ghosts onto theatre stages through light and reflection.

“Pepper’s ghost has typically been used in theatre, film and amusement park rides. This simple effect uses an angled pane of glass to create the illusion of a ghost-like image within another scene, exploiting the optical properties of glass as both a reflector and transmitter of light.

In my work I wanted to replicate this effect using simple abstract forms and flat fields of colour to draw attention to this merging of the two light images, while also laying bare the apparatus used to create the illusion.” – Taree Mackenzie

Taree Mackenzie, Australia

results.title: Peoples of the Skeena
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Getikshan and Tsimshian Indians of northern British Columbia live in two worlds. Against the mountains and forests tower the ancient totem poles; the old graveyards reveal past history; on the reserves the traditional crafts are still practised. But in the school games, in the wedding complete with white veil and white rice, and in the sawmill we see how other ways are being adopted. As climax, the film shows the action-packed rodeo at Kispiox.
